title: Saudi Arabia puts women on frontlines? KSA Interior Ministry graduates 328 female security recruits
summary_full: Saudi Arabia's Public Security Directorate celebrated a significant milestone with 328 women graduating from basic security training. This marks a crucial step in integrating females into frontline roles, aligning with Vision 2030's reform agenda. The recruits are now equipped for diverse security assignments, enhancing the nation's operational capacity and promoting gender inclusion in national service.
